CVE-2025-26598
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-02-25T18:31:30

2 posts

An out-of-bounds write flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. The function GetBarrierDevice() searches for the pointer device based on its device ID and returns the matching value, or supposedly NULL, if no match was found. However, the code will return the last element of the list if no matching device ID is found, which can lead to out-of-bounds memory access.

cR0w at 2025-02-25T17:35:31.583Z ##

Red Hat published eight sev:HIGH CVEs in X dot org and Xwayland. I don't feel like going through the details here. If you're impacted, you know how to dig into it. I hope.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26594

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26595

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26596

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26597

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26598

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26599

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26600

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26601

##

CVE-2025-26595
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-02-25T18:31:30

2 posts

A buffer overflow flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. The code in XkbVModMaskText() allocates a fixed-sized buffer on the stack and copies the names of the virtual modifiers to that buffer. The code fails to check the bounds of the buffer and would copy the data regardless of the size.

##

CVE-2025-26601
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-02-25T18:31:30

2 posts

A use-after-free flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. When changing an alarm, the values of the change mask are evaluated one after the other, changing the trigger values as requested, and eventually, SyncInitTrigger() is called. If one of the changes triggers an error, the function will return early, not adding the new sync object, possibly causing a use-after-free when the alarm eventually trig

##

CVE-2025-26594
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-02-25T18:31:30

2 posts

A use-after-free flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. The root cursor is referenced in the X server as a global variable. If a client frees the root cursor, the internal reference points to freed memory and causes a use-after-free.

##

CVE-2025-26600
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-02-25T18:31:30

2 posts

A use-after-free flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. When a device is removed while still frozen, the events queued for that device remain while the device is freed. Replaying the events will cause a use-after-free.

##

CVE-2025-1068
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-02-25T17:15:13.890000

2 posts

There is an untrusted search path vulnerability in Esri ArcGIS AllSource 1.2 and 1.3 that may allow a low privileged attacker with write privileges to the local file system to introduce a malicious executable to the filesystem. When the victim performs a specific action using ArcGIS AllSource, the file could execute and run malicious commands under the context of the victim.

cR0w at 2025-02-25T17:15:09.196Z ##

ESRI put out an advisory for a couple sev:HIGH search path vulns in ArcGIS Pro a few weeks ago and the CVEs were published today.

https://www.esri.com/arcgis-blog/products/administration/administration/arcgis-pro-and-arcgis-allsource-patches-address-high-severity-vulnerabilities/

There is an untrusted search path vulnerability in Esri ArcGIS Pro 3.3 and 3.4 that may allow a low privileged attacker with write privileges to the local file system to introduce a malicious executable to the filesystem. When the victim performs a specific action using ArcGIS

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1067

There is an untrusted search path vulnerability in Esri ArcGIS AllSource 1.2 and 1.3 that may allow a low privileged attacker with write privileges to the local file system to introduce a malicious executable to the filesystem. When the victim performs a specific action using ArcGIS AllSource, the file could execute and run malicious commands under the context of the victim.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1067

There is an untrusted search path vulnerability in Esri ArcGIS AllSource 1.2 and 1.3 that may allow a low privileged attacker with write privileges to the local file system to introduce a malicious executable to the filesystem. When the victim performs a specific action using ArcGIS AllSource, the file could execute and run malicious commands under the context of the victim.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1068

##

CVE-2025-26599
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-02-25T16:15:39.163000

2 posts

An access to an uninitialized pointer flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. The function compCheckRedirect() may fail if it cannot allocate the backing pixmap. In that case, compRedirectWindow() will return a BadAlloc error without validating the window tree marked just before, which leaves the validated data partly initialized and the use of an uninitialized pointer later.

##

CVE-2025-26597
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-02-25T16:15:38.797000

2 posts

A buffer overflow flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. If XkbChangeTypesOfKey() is called with a 0 group, it will resize the key symbols table to 0 but leave the key actions unchanged. If the same function is later called with a non-zero value of groups, this will cause a buffer overflow because the key actions are of the wrong size.

CVE-2025-26596
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-02-25T16:15:38.603000

2 posts

A heap overflow flaw was found in X.Org and Xwayland. The computation of the length in XkbSizeKeySyms() differs from what is written in XkbWriteKeySyms(), which may lead to a heap-based buffer overflow.

Zimbra Collaboration (aka ZCS) 8.8.15 and 9.0 has mboximport functionality that receives a ZIP archive and extracts files from it. An authenticated user with administrator rights has the ability to upload arbitrary files to the system, leading to directory traversal.

CVE-2025-27364
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-02-24T20:15:34.180000

4 posts

In MITRE Caldera through 4.2.0 and 5.0.0 before 35bc06e, a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability was found in the dynamic agent (implant) compilation functionality of the server. This allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on the server that Caldera is running on via a crafted web request to the Caldera server API used for compiling and downloading of Caldera's Sandcat or Manx agent

DarkWebInformer at 2025-02-24T20:04:14.271Z ##

ð¨CVE-2025-27364: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

CVSS: 10

https://darkwebinformer.com/cve-2025-27364-improper-neutralization-of-special-elements-used-in-an-os-command-os-command-injection/

##
cR0w at 2025-02-24T19:39:56.736Z ##

A perfect 10 in MITRE Caldera? Nice. ð¥³

https://medium.com/@mitrecaldera/mitre-caldera-security-advisory-remote-code-execution-cve-2025-27364-5f679e2e2a0e

In MITRE Caldera through 4.2.0 and 5.0.0 before 35bc06e, a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability was found in the dynamic agent (implant) compilation functionality of the server. This allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on the server that Caldera is running on via a crafted web request to the Caldera server API used for compiling and downloading of Caldera's Sandcat or Manx agent (implants). This web request can use the gcc -extldflags linker flag with sub-commands.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27364

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T19:39:56.000Z ##

A perfect 10 in MITRE Caldera? Nice. ð¥³

https://medium.com/@mitrecaldera/mitre-caldera-security-advisory-remote-code-execution-cve-2025-27364-5f679e2e2a0e

In MITRE Caldera through 4.2.0 and 5.0.0 before 35bc06e, a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability was found in the dynamic agent (implant) compilation functionality of the server. This allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on the server that Caldera is running on via a crafted web request to the Caldera server API used for compiling and downloading of Caldera's Sandcat or Manx agent (implants). This web request can use the gcc -extldflags linker flag with sub-commands.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27364

##

CVE-2025-26793(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-24T18:32:37

2 posts

The Web GUI configuration panel of Hirsch (formerly Identiv and Viscount) Enterphone MESH through 2024 ships with default credentials (username freedom, password viscount). The administrator is not prompted to change these credentials on initial configuration, and changing the credentials requires many steps. Attackers can use the credentials over the Internet via mesh.webadmin.MESHAdminServlet to

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T15:07:05.000Z ##

Another perfect 10. ð¥³

Officially. On paper, at least.

This one caught my eye because it's a Hirsch access control panel. Hirsch physical security systems are used in some interesting locations. This one turned out to be an acquired one by Viscount, so not so juicy. However, it did lead to another interesting facepalm regarding CVEs.

Here is the write-up for it: https://www.ericdaigle.ca/posts/breaking-into-dozens-of-apartments-in-five-minutes/

Interesting enough. Go have fun. However, it hardly seems like a proper perfect 10. The description is even more to the point, and while I don't think the vendor is free from sin here, they have a valid point:

The Web GUI configuration panel of Hirsch (formerly Identiv and Viscount) Enterphone MESH through 2024 ships with default credentials (username freedom, password viscount). The administrator is not prompted to change these credentials on initial configuration, and changing the credentials requires many steps. Attackers can use the credentials over the Internet via mesh.webadmin.MESHAdminServlet to gain access to dozens of Canadian and U.S. apartment buildings and obtain building residents' PII. NOTE: the Supplier's perspective is that the "vulnerable systems are not following manufacturers' recommendations to change the default password."

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26793

If this were indeed a legitimate perfect 10 CVE, y'all can go pad those resumes with a ton more default creds that are "not prompted to change" on initial configuration.

:dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif: :dumpster_fire_gif:

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-16T02:24:28.000Z ##

ð¨Critical Security Vulnerability in Hirsch Enterphone MESH

ð CVE: CVE-2025-26793
ð£ CVSS Score: 10
ð Published Date: 25/02/15
â ï¸ Details: The Web GUI configuration panel of Hirsch (formerly Identiv and Viscount) Enterphone MESH through 2024 ships with default credentials (username freedom, password viscount).

The administrator is not prompted to change these credentials on initial configuration, and changing the credentials requires many steps.

Attackers can use the credentials over the Internet via mesh.webadmin.MESHAdminServlet to gain access to dozens of Canadian and U.S. apartment buildings and obtain building residents' PII.

NOTE: the Supplier's perspective is that the "vulnerable systems are not following manufacturers' recommendations to change the default password."

NIST: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26793

An improper input validation vulnerability was discovered in the NTP server configuration field of the Network-M2 card. This could result in an authenticated high privileged user having the ability to execute arbitrary commands. The vulnerability has been resolved in the version 3.0.4. Note - Network-M2 has been declared end-of-life in early 2024 and Network-M3 has been released as a fit-and-func

cR0w at 2025-02-24T17:33:56.481Z ##

I love NTP vulns for reasons and a forever-day is even better. Granted, this one appears to be post-auth, but given where Eaton devices tend to be used, it might be a good one to keep in the back pocket.

sev:HIGH 8.4 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

https://www.eaton.com/content/dam/eaton/company/news-insights/cybersecurity/security-bulletins/etn-va-2025-1004.pdf

An improper input validation vulnerability was discovered in the NTP server configuration field of the Network-M2 card. This could result in an authenticated high privileged user having the ability to execute arbitrary commands. The vulnerability has been resolved in the version 3.0.4. Note - Network-M2 has been declared end-of-life in early 2024 and Network-M3 has been released as a fit-and-functional replacement.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-22495

CVE-2025-1632
(3.3 LOW)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-02-24T15:15:13.217000

1 posts

A vulnerability was found in libarchive up to 3.7.7. It has been classified as problematic. This affects the function list of the file bsdunzip.c. The manipulation leads to null pointer dereference. It is possible to launch the attack on the local host. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T15:13:43.000Z ##

Apparently there's a null pointer dereference vuln in libarchive up to 3.7.7 that has been ignored by the vendor. There's a supposed PoC zip file published but I don't have the time or fucks to dig into it right now.

https://github.com/Ekkosun/pocs/blob/main/bsdunzip-poc

A vulnerability was found in libarchive up to 3.7.7. It has been classified as problematic. This affects the function list of the file bsdunzip.c. The manipulation leads to null pointer dereference. It is possible to launch the attack on the local host. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1632

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T07:22:05.000Z ##

Okay folks, Microsoft's at it again with the patches! This time, Bing and Power Pages are in the hot seat. Remote Code Execution and privilege escalation â sounds like a party for attackers, but definitely not for us defenders! ð

First up, CVE-2025-21355 (Bing): We're talking Remote Code Execution here! Microsoft says they've fixed it server-side, but still, it's always best to stay vigilant and double-check your systems. You can never be too careful!

Then we have CVE-2025-24989 (Power Pages): Exploitation detected, with privilege escalation as the main course. Microsoft's already notified affected customers, so take a peek at your inbox just in case!

You know, permissions are often the name of the game in security. Get 'em wrong, and you're basically leaving the door wide open. So, check those logs, keep an eye out for any weird activity â it's seriously important! Automated scans are great and all, but let's be real, a proper pentest will always dig up more dirt.

So, how are you all securing your web applications? Got any best practices you'd like to share with the rest of us? I'm all ears! Let's swap some knowledge!

#infosec #pentest #security #microsoft

CVE-2025-25279
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2025-02-24T08:15:10.607000

1 posts

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to properly validate board blocks when importing boards which allows an attacker could read any arbitrary file on the system via importing and exporting a specially crafted import archive in Boards.

1 repos

https://github.com/numanturle/CVE-2025-25279

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T15:18:33.000Z ##

Mattermost released a security advisory last week but there are no details besides the CVEs.

https://mattermost.com/security-updates/

Details on the security update will be posted here on March 21 as per our Responsible Disclosure Policy.

So here are some descriptions on the three sev:CRIT vulns I see:

sev:CRIT 9.6 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:N

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to use prepared statements in the SQL query of boards reordering which allows an attacker to retrieve data from the database, via a SQL injection when reordering specially crafted boards categories.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-24490

sev:CRIT 9.9 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to properly validate input when patching and duplicating a board, which allows a user to read any arbitrary file on the system via duplicating a specially crafted block in Boards.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-20051

sev:CRIT 9.9 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to properly validate board blocks when importing boards which allows an attacker could read any arbitrary file on the system via importing and exporting a specially crafted import archive in Boards.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-25279

https://darkwebinformer.com/cve-2025-20051-24490-25279-mattermost-boards-arbitrary-file-read-vulnerability-in-multiple-versions/

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T17:38:10.000Z ##

ð¨CVE-2025-20051/24490/25279: Mattermost Boards Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability in Multiple Versions

https://darkwebinformer.com/cve-2025-20051-24490-25279-mattermost-boards-arbitrary-file-read-vulnerability-in-multiple-versions/

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T15:18:33.000Z ##

Mattermost released a security advisory last week but there are no details besides the CVEs.

https://mattermost.com/security-updates/

Details on the security update will be posted here on March 21 as per our Responsible Disclosure Policy.

So here are some descriptions on the three sev:CRIT vulns I see:

sev:CRIT 9.6 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:N

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to use prepared statements in the SQL query of boards reordering which allows an attacker to retrieve data from the database, via a SQL injection when reordering specially crafted boards categories.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-24490

sev:CRIT 9.9 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to properly validate input when patching and duplicating a board, which allows a user to read any arbitrary file on the system via duplicating a specially crafted block in Boards.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-20051

sev:CRIT 9.9 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H

Mattermost versions 10.4.x <= 10.4.1, 9.11.x <= 9.11.7, 10.3.x <= 10.3.2, 10.2.x <= 10.2.2 fail to properly validate board blocks when importing boards which allows an attacker could read any arbitrary file on the system via importing and exporting a specially crafted import archive in Boards.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-25279

##

CVE-2025-27106
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-02-22T16:15:33.003000

1 posts

binance-trading-bot is an automated Binance trading bot with trailing buy/sell strategy. Authenticated users of binance-trading-bot can achieve Remote Code Execution on the host system due to a command injection vulnerability in the `/restore` endpoint. The restore endpoint of binance-trading-bot is vulnerable to command injection via the `/restore` endpoint. The name of the uploaded file is passe

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T22:18:57.000Z ##

Post-auth command injection in binance-trading-bot. I don't imagine it directly impact most people's jobs but anything to disrupt the cryptocurrency scam market is cool with me.

sev:HIGH 7.7 - CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:P/PR:L/UI:N/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N

https://github.com/chrisleekr/binance-trading-bot/security/advisories/GHSA-wq6j-4388-4gg5

binance-trading-bot is an automated Binance trading bot with trailing buy/sell strategy. Authenticated users of binance-trading-bot can achieve Remote Code Execution on the host system due to a command injection vulnerability in the /restore endpoint. The restore endpoint of binance-trading-bot is vulnerable to command injection via the /restore endpoint. The name of the uploaded file is passed to shell.exec without sanitization other than path normalization, resulting in Remote Code Execution. This may allow any authorized user to execute code in the context of the host machine. This issue has been addressed in version 0.0.100 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27106

CVE-2019-8900
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-22T16:15:30.333000

1 posts

A vulnerability in the SecureROM of some Apple devices can be exploited by an unauthenticated local attacker to execute arbitrary code upon booting those devices. This vulnerability allows arbitrary code to be executed on the device. Exploiting the vulnerability requires physical access to the device: the device must be plugged in to a computer upon booting, and it must be put into Device Firmware

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T22:28:02.000Z ##

Oh look, Apple finally published a CVE for Checkm8. If that seems like it came out a lifetime ago, it's because it did. The original advisory was published in 2019.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8900

https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/941987

4 posts

The The Custom Post Type Date Archives plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary shortcode execution in all versions up to, and including, 2.7.1. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary shortcodes.

##

CVE-2024-54959
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-21T22:15:12.593000

1 posts

Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 is vulnerable to a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack through the Favorites component, enabling POST-based Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T19:29:54.000Z ##

Nagios XI with several CVEs published today. The CVEs don't link to anything directly from Nagios, just the reporter's Github pages. The Github pages say the mitigation is to "Update to the latest version" so I assume that there is a patched version. But I don't run Nagios so I can't be bothered to look.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-54959

Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 is vulnerable to a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack through the Favorites component, enabling POST-based Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-54960

A SQL Injection vulnerability in Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 allows a remote attacker to execute SQL injection via a crafted payload in the History Tab component.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-54961

Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 has an Information Disclosure vulnerability, which allows unauthenticated users to access multiple pages displaying the usernames and email addresses of all current users.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-54958

Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 is susceptible to a stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Tools page. This flaw allows an attacker to inject malicious scripts into the Tools interface, which are then stored and executed in the context of other users accessing the page.

updated 2025-02-21T21:33:10

5 posts

Opera Mini for Android before version 52.2 is vulnerable to an address bar spoofing attack. The vulnerability allows a malicious page to trick the browser into showing an address of a different page. This may allow the malicious page to impersonate another page and trick a user into providing sensitive data.

CVE-2025-1094
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-21T18:15:20.033000

5 posts

Improper neutralization of quoting syntax in PostgreSQL libpq functions PQescapeLiteral(), PQescapeIdentifier(), PQescapeString(), and PQescapeStringConn() allows a database input provider to achieve SQL injection in certain usage patterns. Specifically, SQL injection requires the application to use the function result to construct input to psql, the PostgreSQL interactive terminal. Similarly, i

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-02-18T21:25:02.000Z ##

> Threat actors combined a BeyondTrust zero-day (CVE-2024-12356) with a new PostgreSQL vulnerability (CVE-2025-1094).
CVE-2025-1094 allows for SQL injection and shell command execution through PostgreSQLâs psql interactive tool.

> Successful exploitation leads to arbitrary code execution. Affected PostgreSQL versions: 13â17 (fixed in latest patches).

Read more on HackerNews: https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/postgresql-vulnerability-exploited.html

CVE-2025-1538
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.23%

updated 2025-02-21T15:32:08

5 posts

A vulnerability classified as critical was found in D-Link DAP-1320 1.00. Affected by this vulnerability is the function set_ws_action of the file /dws/api/. The manipulation leads to heap-based buffer overflow. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T15:16:28.000Z ##

Here's a couple sev:CRIT forever-days in the EoL D-Link DAP-1320.

A vulnerability classified as critical was found in D-Link DAP-1320 1.00. Affected by this vulnerability is the function set_ws_action of the file /dws/api/. The manipulation leads to heap-based buffer overflow. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1538

PoC: https://tasty-foxtrot-3a8.notion.site/D-link-DAP-1320-set_ws_action-Vulnerability-1950448e61958049be3cc606d434bc9d

A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in D-Link DAP-1320 1.00. Affected by this issue is the function replace_special_char of the file /storagein.pd-XXXXXX. The manipulation leads to stack-based buffer overflow. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1539

PoC: https://tasty-foxtrot-3a8.notion.site/D-link-DAP-1320-replace_special_char-Vulnerability-1960448e6195809c94f9fd2ff1f59bcf

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T15:13:16.000Z ##

sev:CRIT PreAuth command injection in Raisecom gateways.

A vulnerability was found in Raisecom Multi-Service Intelligent Gateway up to 20250208. It has been declared as critical. This vulnerability affects unknown code of the file /vpn/vpn_template_style.php of the component Request Parameter Handler. The manipulation of the argument stylenum leads to os command injection. The attack can be initiated remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1536

PoC: https://github.com/koishi0x01/CVE/blob/main/CVE_1.md

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T15:16:28.000Z ##

Here's a couple sev:CRIT forever-days in the EoL D-Link DAP-1320.

A vulnerability classified as critical was found in D-Link DAP-1320 1.00. Affected by this vulnerability is the function set_ws_action of the file /dws/api/. The manipulation leads to heap-based buffer overflow. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1538

PoC: https://tasty-foxtrot-3a8.notion.site/D-link-DAP-1320-set_ws_action-Vulnerability-1950448e61958049be3cc606d434bc9d

The manipulation leads to stack-based buffer overflow. The attack may be launched remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-1539

DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T19:37:56.000Z ##

ð¨ Critical Security Vulnerability
ð CVE-2024-12860
ð£ CVSS Score: 9.8
ð Published Date: 25/02/18
â ï¸ Details: The CarSpot â Dealership Wordpress Classified Theme theme for WordPress is vulnerable to privilege escalation via account takeover in all versions up to, and including, 2.4.3. This is due to the plugin not properly validating a token prior to updating a user's password. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to change arbitrary user's passwords, including administrators, and leverage that to gain access to their account.

**Deutsche Version (Umschrieben):**

Moin Leute! CISA KEV meldet sich mal wieder zu Wort ð¨ Und diesmal geht's um Palo Alto (CVE-2025-0108) und SonicWall (CVE-2024-53704). Die haben's echt faustdick hinter den Ohren! Wir reden hier von Authentication Bypass und Improper Auth, und zwar direkt im VPN-Bereich. Das tut weh!

Als Pentester sehe ich sowas ja leider tÃ¤glich. ð© VPNs sind halt oft die Haupteinfallsrouten. Wenn da Unbefugte reinkommen, ist das natÃ¼rlich megaÃ¤tzend. Und hinterher heiÃt es dann immer: "HÃ¤tten wir doch bloÃ..."

Und das Schlimmste: Palo Alto kann man sogar noch chainen (CVE-2024-9474 & CVE-2025-0111) ð¤¯ GreyNoise hat bereits Exploits entdeckt! Also, Leute, was heiÃt das? Patchen, patchen, patchen! Security by Design muss einfach Standard sein!

Habt ihr eure Systeme schon geupdatet? Wie sind eure Erfahrungen mit Palo Alto/SonicWall? ErzÃ¤hlt mal, bin gespannt!

#infosec #pentest #cisa #vpn

**Englische Version (Umschrieben und Ãbersetzt):**

Hey everyone! CISA KEV is back with an update ð¨ This time it's about Palo Alto (CVE-2025-0108) and SonicWall (CVE-2024-53704), and let me tell you, these are nasty! We're talking about Authentication Bypass and Improper Auth, right in the VPN space. Ouch!

As a pentester, I see this stuff all the time, unfortunately. ð© VPNs are often the number one entry point. Unauthorized access? That's a big no-no. And then everyone says, "If only we had..."

But here's the kicker: you can even chain Palo Alto (CVE-2024-9474 & CVE-2025-0111) ð¤¯ GreyNoise has already spotted exploits in the wild! So what does that mean? Patch, patch, patch! Security by Design simply has to be the standard!

Have you updated your systems yet? What are your experiences with Palo Alto/SonicWall? Let me know in the comments!

#infosec #pentest #cisa #vpn

(8.0 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.90%

updated 2025-02-21T14:48:55.367000

Craft is a flexible, user-friendly CMS for creating custom digital experiences on the web and beyond. This is an remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability that affects Craft 4 and 5 installs where your security key has already been compromised. Anyone running an unpatched version of Craft with a compromised security key is affected. This vulnerability has been patched in Craft 5.5.8 and 4.13.8. Us

CISA Flags Craft CMS Vulnerability CVE-2025-23209 Amid Active Attacks https://thehackernews.com/2025/02/cisa-flags-craft-cms-vulnerability-cve.html

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T09:20:28.000Z ##

Okay, folks, listen up! Craft CMS users, this is a HUGE heads-up! ð¨ CISA just added CVE-2025-23209 to their Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) list. Remote Code Execution (RCE) is a real threat! ð¤¯

If you're running Craft CMS (versions 4 & 5, specifically anything before 4.13.8 or 5.5.8), you've gotta update, like, NOW! Seriously, code injection isn't a game. RCE means an attacker can basically take complete control of your system. Think of it as someone waltzing into your house and doing whatever they want! It's that serious.

Worried your security key might be compromised? ð¥ That's a worst-case scenario! If that's the case, rotate your keys ASAP! Patching is definitely the better solution, no doubt. But here's the real question: How were those keys stolen in the first place? That's what we need to figure out!

Automated scans are great, but let's be honest, a proper penetration test is what *really* uncovers these kinds of vulnerabilities. Our clients are always thrilled when we catch stuff like this before it becomes a major problem. ð IT security isn't just a "nice-to-have," it's absolutely essential for protecting your business.

So, I'm curious: What CMS are you guys using, and what steps are you taking to keep it secure? ð¤ Share your thoughts!

#infosec #pentest #craftcms #rce #cisa

(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-20T21:15:26.510000

1 posts

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T14:32:54.000Z ##

Looks like there's finally a CVE for Sitecore's sev:CRIT RCE from December.

https://support.sitecore.com/kb?id=kb_article_view&sysparm_article=KB1003535

Sitecore Experience Manager (XM) and Experience Platform (XP) 10.4 before KB1002844 allow remote code execution through insecure deserialization.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27218

##

CVE-2025-24893
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-20T20:15:46.697000

1 posts

XWiki Platform is a generic wiki platform offering runtime services for applications built on top of it. Any guest can perform arbitrary remote code execution through a request to `SolrSearch`. This impacts the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the whole XWiki installation. To reproduce on an instance, without being logged in, go to `<host>/xwiki/bin/get/Main/SolrSearch?media=rss&text

Nuclei template

2 repos

https://github.com/iSee857/CVE-2025-24893-PoC

https://github.com/sug4r-wr41th/CVE-2025-24893

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T19:59:29.000Z ##

sev:CRIT RCE in XWiki. Per Shodan, there are a few hundred of those on the public Internet including some that may be interesting for, uh, researchers.

CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/security/advisories/GHSA-rr6p-3pfg-562j

XWiki Platform is a generic wiki platform offering runtime services for applications built on top of it. Any guest can perform arbitrary remote code execution through a request to SolrSearch. This impacts the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the whole XWiki installation. To reproduce on an instance, without being logged in, go to <host>/xwiki/bin/get/Main/SolrSearch?media=rss&text=%7D%7D%7D%7B%7Basync%20async%3Dfalse%7D%7D%7B%7Bgroovy%7D%7Dprintln%28"Hello%20from"%20%2B%20"%20search%20text%3A"%20%2B%20%2823%20%2B%2019%29%29%7B%7B%2Fgroovy%7D%7D%7B%7B%2Fasync%7D%7D%20. If there is an output, and the title of the RSS feed contains Hello from search text:42, then the instance is vulnerable. This vulnerability has been patched in XWiki 15.10.11, 16.4.1 and 16.5.0RC1. Users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to upgrade may edit Main.SolrSearchMacros in SolrSearchMacros.xml on line 955 to match the rawResponse macro in macros.vm#L2824 with a content type of application/xml, instead of simply outputting the content of the feed.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-24893

##

CVE-2024-54961
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-20T20:15:46.077000

1 posts

Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 has an Information Disclosure vulnerability, which allows unauthenticated users to access multiple pages displaying the usernames and email addresses of all current users.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T19:29:54.000Z ##

Nagios XI with several CVEs published today. The CVEs don't link to anything directly from Nagios, just the reporter's Github pages. The Github pages say the mitigation is to "Update to the latest version" so I assume that there is a patched version. But I don't run Nagios so I can't be bothered to look.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-54959

Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 is vulnerable to a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack through the Favorites component, enabling POST-based Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-54960

A SQL Injection vulnerability in Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 allows a remote attacker to execute SQL injection via a crafted payload in the History Tab component.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-54961

Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 has an Information Disclosure vulnerability, which allows unauthenticated users to access multiple pages displaying the usernames and email addresses of all current users.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-54958

Nagios XI 2024R1.2.2 is susceptible to a stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Tools page. This flaw allows an attacker to inject malicious scripts into the Tools interface, which are then stored and executed in the context of other users accessing the page.

A vulnerability, that could result in Remote Code Execution (RCE), has been found in DocsGPT. Due to improper parsing of JSON data using eval() an unauthorized attacker could send arbitrary Python code to be executed via /api/remote endpoint. This issue affects DocsGPT: from 0.8.1 through 0.12.0.

(9.1 CRITICAL)

updated 2025-02-20T03:15:12.317000

18 posts

An authentication bypass in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an unauthenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to bypass the authentication otherwise required by the PAN-OS management web interface and invoke certain PHP scripts. While invoking these PHP scripts does not enable remote code execution, it can negatively impact integrity and confidentiality

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T22:49:50.000Z ##

ð¨ High Security Vulnerability
ð CVE-2025-0108
ð£ CVSS Score: 8.8
ð Published Date: 25/02/12
â ï¸ Details: An authentication bypass in the Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables an unauthenticated attacker with network access to the management web interface to bypass the authentication otherwise required by the PAN-OS management web interface and invoke certain PHP scripts. While invoking these PHP scripts does not enable remote code execution, it can negatively impact integrity and confidentiality of PAN-OS. You can greatly reduce the risk of this issue by restricting access to the management web interface to only trusted internal IP addresses according to our recommended best practices deployment guidelines

https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/community-blogs/tips-amp-tricks-how-to-secure-the-management-access-of-your-palo/ba-p/464431 .

This issue does not affect Cloud NGFW or Prisma Access software.

NIST: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0108
Reference: https://securityadvisories.paloaltonetworks.com/CVE-2025-0108

Palo Alto Networks warns that hackers are actively exploiting a critical authentication bypass flaw (CVE-2025-0108) in PAN-OS firewalls, chaining...

Als Pentester sehe ich sowas ja leider tÃ¤glich. ð© VPNs sind halt oft die Haupteinfallsrouten. Wenn da Unbefugte reinkommen, ist das natÃ¼rlich megaÃ¤tzend. Und hinterher heiÃt es dann immer: "HÃ¤tten wir doch bloÃ..."

Und das Schlimmste: Palo Alto kann man sogar noch chainen (CVE-2024-9474 & CVE-2025-0111) ð¤¯ GreyNoise hat bereits Exploits entdeckt! Also, Leute, was heiÃt das? Patchen, patchen, patchen! Security by Design muss einfach Standard sein!

**Englische Version (Umschrieben und Ãbersetzt):**

Hey everyone! CISA KEV is back with an update ð¨ This time it's about Palo Alto (CVE-2025-0108) and SonicWall (CVE-2024-53704), and let me tell you, these are nasty! We're talking about Authentication Bypass and Improper Auth, right in the VPN space. Ouch!

As a pentester, I see this stuff all the time, unfortunately. ð© VPNs are often the number one entry point. Unauthorized access? That's a big no-no. And then everyone says, "If only we had..."

But here's the kicker: you can even chain Palo Alto (CVE-2024-9474 & CVE-2025-0111) ð¤¯ GreyNoise has already spotted exploits in the wild! So what does that mean? Patch, patch, patch! Security by Design simply has to be the standard!

Have you updated your systems yet? What are your experiences with Palo Alto/SonicWall? Let me know in the comments!

#infosec #pentest #cisa #vpn

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T07:22:05.000Z ##

Okay folks, Microsoft's at it again with the patches! This time, Bing and Power Pages are in the hot seat. Remote Code Execution and privilege escalation â sounds like a party for attackers, but definitely not for us defenders! ð

First up, CVE-2025-21355 (Bing): We're talking Remote Code Execution here! Microsoft says they've fixed it server-side, but still, it's always best to stay vigilant and double-check your systems. You can never be too careful!

Then we have CVE-2025-24989 (Power Pages): Exploitation detected, with privilege escalation as the main course. Microsoft's already notified affected customers, so take a peek at your inbox just in case!

You know, permissions are often the name of the game in security. Get 'em wrong, and you're basically leaving the door wide open. So, check those logs, keep an eye out for any weird activity â it's seriously important! Automated scans are great and all, but let's be real, a proper pentest will always dig up more dirt.

So, how are you all securing your web applications? Got any best practices you'd like to share with the rest of us? I'm all ears! Let's swap some knowledge!

#infosec #pentest #security #microsoft

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T07:14:36.000Z ##

Okay folks, Citrix and NetScaler... sound familiar to anyone else? ð Guess what? Another vulnerability alert! This time it's a Privilege Escalation (CVE-2024-12284) in the Console/Agent. Ouch! If someone gets in, they could snag more permissions than they're supposed to.

Hereâs whatâs affected:

* Version 14.1 before 14.1-38.53
* Version 13.1 before 13.1-56.18

So, what should you do? Update ASAP to 14.1-38.53+ or 13.1-56.18+! No workarounds this time, unfortunately.

As a pentester, I hate to say it, but I see this kind of thing *all* the time: incorrect permissions are like hitting the jackpot for attackers. ð¤¦ So please, check your NetScalers! And remember, you've gotta do regular pentests! "Security by Design" isn't just a buzzword, it's a necessity.

How are you securing your NetScaler environments? Any experiences with this patch you'd like to share? Let me know below! ð

#infosec #pentest #citrix #netscaler

##

CVE-2025-27092
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-19T23:15:15.957000

2 posts

GHOSTS is an open source user simulation framework for cyber experimentation, simulation, training, and exercise. A path traversal vulnerability was discovered in GHOSTS version 8.0.0.0 that allows an attacker to access files outside of the intended directory through the photo retrieval endpoint. The vulnerability exists in the /api/npcs/{id}/photo endpoint, which is designed to serve profile phot

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T15:17:44.000Z ##

I honestly don't even know what most of this means or what "an open source user simulation framework for cyber experimentation, simulation, training, and exercise" is, but from what I gather this is a sev:CRIT ../ vuln exploitable by NPCs and that thought entertains me for some reason.

https://github.com/cmu-sei/GHOSTS/security/advisories/GHSA-qr67-m6w9-wj3j

GHOSTS is an open source user simulation framework for cyber experimentation, simulation, training, and exercise. A path traversal vulnerability was discovered in GHOSTS version 8.0.0.0 that allows an attacker to access files outside of the intended directory through the photo retrieval endpoint. The vulnerability exists in the /api/npcs/{id}/photo endpoint, which is designed to serve profile photos for NPCs (Non-Player Characters) but fails to properly validate and sanitize file paths. When an NPC is created with a specially crafted photoLink value containing path traversal sequences (../, ..\, etc.), the application processes these sequences without proper sanitization. This allows an attacker to traverse directory structures and access files outside of the intended photo directory, potentially exposing sensitive system files. The vulnerability is particularly severe because it allows reading arbitrary files from the server's filesystem with the permissions of the web application process, which could include configuration files, credentials, or other sensitive data. This issue has been addressed in version 8.2.7.90 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27092

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T23:07:34.000Z ##

ð¨ High Security Vulnerability
ð CVE-2025-27092
ð£ CVSS Score: 8.7
ð Published Date: 2025-02-19

â ï¸ Details: GHOSTS is an open source user simulation framework for cyber experimentation, simulation, training, and exercise. A path traversal vulnerability was discovered in GHOSTS version 8.0.0.0 that allows an attacker to access files outside of the intended directory through the photo retrieval endpoint. The vulnerability exists in the /api/npcs/{id}/photo endpoint, which is designed to serve profile photos for NPCs (Non-Player Characters) but fails to properly validate and sanitize file paths. When an NPC is created with a specially crafted photoLink value containing path traversal sequences (../, ..\, etc.), the application processes these sequences without proper sanitization. This allows an attacker to traverse directory structures and access files outside of the intended photo directory, potentially exposing sensitive system files. The vulnerability is particularly severe because it allows reading arbitrary files from the server's filesystem with the permissions of the web application process, which could include configuration files, credentials, or other sensitive data. This issue has been addressed in version 8.2.7.90 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

ð  References:
ð GitHub 1: https://github.com/cmu-sei/GHOSTS/security/advisories/GHSA-qr67-m6w9-wj3j
ð GitHub 2: https://github.com/cmu-sei/GHOSTS/commit/e69827556a52ff813de00e1017c4b62598d2c887

CVE-2025-0677
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-19T19:15:15.280000

4 posts

A flaw was found in grub2. When performing a symlink lookup, the grub's UFS module checks the inode's data size to allocate the internal buffer to read the file content, however, it fails to check if the symlink data size has overflown. When this occurs, grub_malloc() may be called with a smaller value than needed. When further reading the data from the disk into the buffer, the grub_ufs_lookup_sy

CVE-2025-0624
(7.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-19T19:15:15.120000

5 posts

A flaw was found in grub2. During the network boot process, when trying to search for the configuration file, grub copies data from a user controlled environment variable into an internal buffer using the grub_strcpy() function. During this step, it fails to consider the environment variable length when allocating the internal buffer, resulting in an out-of-bounds write. If correctly exploited, th

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-02-20T05:43:11.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2025-0624 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2025-0624/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2025_0624

##
RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-02-20T05:43:11.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2025-0624 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2025-0624/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2025_0624

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T21:04:00.000Z ##

I guess technically it's grub_strcpy() but close enough.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2346112

A flaw was found in grub2. During the network boot process, when trying to search for the configuration file, grub copies data from a user controlled environment variable into an internal buffer using the grub_strcpy() function. During this step, it fails to consider the environment variable length when allocating the internal buffer, resulting in an out-of-bounds write. If correctly exploited, this issue may result in remote code execution through the same network segment grub is searching for the boot information, which can be used to by-pass secure boot protections.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-0624

CVE-2025-1465
(4.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2025-02-19T18:32:30

4 posts

A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, was found in lmxcms 1.41. Affected is an unknown function of the file db.inc.php of the component Maintenance. The manipulation leads to code injection. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The complexity of an attack is rather high. The exploitability is told to be difficult. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be use

##

CVE-2025-1118
(4.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-19T18:15:24.280000

4 posts

A flaw was found in grub2. Grub's dump command is not blocked when grub is in lockdown mode, which allows the user to read any memory information, and an attacker may leverage this in order to extract signatures, salts, and other sensitive information from the memory.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T16:17:00.000Z ##

Several IBM Cognos Controller vulns and I don't use it but the hardcoded creds caught my eye.

https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7183597

There are vulnerabilities in IBMÂ® Javaâ¢, IBMÂ® Websphere Application Server Liberty and Open-Source Software (OSS) components used by IBM Cognos Controller. Additionally, IBM Cognos Controller has addressed vulnerabilities that could lead to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)(CVE-2024-28776), XML External Entity Injection (XXE)(CVE-2023-47160), Unauthorized access (CVE-2024-52902), Incorrect Authorization (CVE-2024-45081), Unrestricted Deserialization (CVE-2024-28777), Decrypt Highly Sensitive Information (CVE-2024-28780) and Formula Injection (CVE-2024-45084). Please refer to the table in the Related Information section for vulnerability impact. This Security Bulletin relates only to the direct usage of third-party components by IBM Cognos Controller and not any nested dependencies within the product.

An Improper Authentication vulnerability in the SSLVPN authentication mechanism allows a remote attacker to bypass authentication.

0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T11:25:07.000Z ##

**Deutsche Version (Umschrieben):**

Moin Leute! CISA KEV meldet sich mal wieder zu Wort ð¨ Und diesmal geht's um Palo Alto (CVE-2025-0108) und SonicWall (CVE-2024-53704). Die haben's echt faustdick hinter den Ohren! Wir reden hier von Authentication Bypass und Improper Auth, und zwar direkt im VPN-Bereich. Das tut weh!

Als Pentester sehe ich sowas ja leider tÃ¤glich. ð© VPNs sind halt oft die Haupteinfallsrouten. Wenn da Unbefugte reinkommen, ist das natÃ¼rlich megaÃ¤tzend. Und hinterher heiÃt es dann immer: "HÃ¤tten wir doch bloÃ..."

Und das Schlimmste: Palo Alto kann man sogar noch chainen (CVE-2024-9474 & CVE-2025-0111) ð¤¯ GreyNoise hat bereits Exploits entdeckt! Also, Leute, was heiÃt das? Patchen, patchen, patchen! Security by Design muss einfach Standard sein!

Habt ihr eure Systeme schon geupdatet? Wie sind eure Erfahrungen mit Palo Alto/SonicWall? ErzÃ¤hlt mal, bin gespannt!

#infosec #pentest #cisa #vpn

**Englische Version (Umschrieben und Ãbersetzt):**

Hey everyone! CISA KEV is back with an update ð¨ This time it's about Palo Alto (CVE-2025-0108) and SonicWall (CVE-2024-53704), and let me tell you, these are nasty! We're talking about Authentication Bypass and Improper Auth, right in the VPN space. Ouch!

As a pentester, I see this stuff all the time, unfortunately. ð© VPNs are often the number one entry point. Unauthorized access? That's a big no-no. And then everyone says, "If only we had..."

But here's the kicker: you can even chain Palo Alto (CVE-2024-9474 & CVE-2025-0111) ð¤¯ GreyNoise has already spotted exploits in the wild! So what does that mean? Patch, patch, patch! Security by Design simply has to be the standard!

Have you updated your systems yet? What are your experiences with Palo Alto/SonicWall? Let me know in the comments!

#infosec #pentest #cisa #vpn

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-53704, is a flaw in the SSL VPN authentication mechanism in SonicOS, the operating system that SonicWall firewalls use. https://www.theregister.com/2025/02/14/sonicwall_firewalls_under_attack_patch/

##

CVE-2025-26465
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-19T15:15:18.090000

18 posts

A vulnerability was found in OpenSSH when the VerifyHostKeyDNS option is enabled. A machine-in-the-middle attack can be performed by a malicious machine impersonating a legit server. This issue occurs due to how OpenSSH mishandles error codes in specific conditions when verifying the host key. For an attack to be considered successful, the attacker needs to manage to exhaust the client's memory re

2 repos

https://github.com/rxerium/CVE-2025-26465

https://github.com/dolutech/patch-manual-CVE-2025-26465-e-CVE-2025-26466

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-02-19T16:50:01.000Z ##

CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466 Vulnerabilities Expose Systems to Man-in-the-Middle and DoS Attacks â Source: socprime.com https://ciso2ciso.com/cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466-vulnerabilities-expose-systems-to-man-in-the-middle-and-dos-attacks-source-socprime-com/ #rssfeedpostgeneratorecho #CyberSecurityNews #cve-2025-26465 #cve-2025-26466 #Latestthreats #Vulnerability #socprimecom #socprime #Blog #CVE

##
BenjaminHCCarr@hachyderm.io at 2025-02-19T15:26:00.000Z ##

New #OpenSSH flaws expose #SSH servers to #MiTM and #DoS attacks
The MiTM vulnerability, tracked under CVE-2025-26465, was introduced in December 2014 with the release of OpenSSH 6.8p1, so the issue remained undetected for over a decade. The flaw affects OpenSSH clients when the '#VerifyHostKeyDNS' option is enabled.
The denial of service vulnerability is CVE-2025-26466, a pre-authentication denial of service flaw introduced in OpenSSH 9.5p1, released in August 2023.
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-openssh-flaws-expose-ssh-servers-to-mitm-and-dos-attacks/

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-02-19T09:06:55.000Z ##

Qualys dropped another two OpenSSH vulns this week - CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466

I donât think either are bad, you should keep calm and patch as per usual.

The first one needs a non-default config, and PoC for the second also uses a non-default config. Neither are RCE and I doubt will ever see in the wild exploitation.

Blog: https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2025/02/18/qualys-tru-discovers-two-vulnerabilities-in-openssh-cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466

Proof of concept: https://www.qualys.com/2025/02/18/openssh-mitm-dos.txt

##
ryanc@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T07:15:11.000Z ##

New SSH CVEs just dropped:

https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2025/02/18/qualys-tru-discovers-two-vulnerabilities-in-openssh-cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T19:30:33.000Z ##

Ugh, OpenSSH *again*... Seriously? We've got two fresh vulnerabilities hitting us, CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466. Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) and Denial of Service (DoS). On the surface, it might not seem like a huge deal, but let's be real â SSH is *everywhere*, isn't it? ð

Turns out, `VerifyHostKeyDNS` is the culprit behind the MitM vulnerability. So, folks, time to double-check your configs! Otherwise, someone could sneak in and snatch your SSH sessions right out from under you. ð¬ And the DoS? That impacts both the client and the server, gobbling up resources left and right. Server goes down, admins get furious, and users get locked out. Not a good look.

Good news, though! OpenSSH 9.9p2 is officially out! So, you know what that means â get patching ASAP! ð

As a pentester, I constantly see how underestimated SSH is. People are all like, "Oh, it's *just* SSH..." Nope! Security in Depth is absolutely crucial. Customers always want to quickly buy a product instead of getting proper consulting.

So, have you already applied the patch? What SSH hardening tips do you swear by? ð¤

#infosec #openssh #pentest

##
Hackread@mstdn.social at 2025-02-18T18:08:37.000Z ##

ð¨ Critical #OpenSSH vulnerabilities found! CVE-2025-26465 enables MITM attacks, while CVE-2025-26466 allows DoS. Upgrade to OpenSSH 9.9p2 now to stay protected! ð

https://hackread.com/critical-openssh-flaws-expose-users-mitm-dos-attacks/

#CyberSecurity #MITM #DoS #Infosec #Vulnerability

##
jschauma@mstdn.social at 2025-02-18T14:42:42.000Z ##

#OpenSSH has a MitM vulnerability when using `VerifyHostKeyDNS` (CVE-2025-26465).

The attack has the hostile server running the client out of memory, which then circumvents the hostkey verification *completely*.

The default for `VerifyHostKeyDNS` is `no`, but if you change that, until you can upgrade to 9.9p2, better keep it at `VerifyHostKeyDNS=no`.

https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2025/02/18/1

##

CVE-2024-52902
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2025-02-19T15:15:14.660000

1 posts

IBM Cognos Controller 11.0.0 through 11.0.1 FP3 and IBM Controller 11.1.0 client application contains hard coded database passwords in source code which could be used for unauthorized access to the system.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T16:17:00.000Z ##

Several IBM Cognos Controller vulns and I don't use it but the hardcoded creds caught my eye.

https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/7183597

There are vulnerabilities in IBMÂ® Javaâ¢, IBMÂ® Websphere Application Server Liberty and Open-Source Software (OSS) components used by IBM Cognos Controller. Additionally, IBM Cognos Controller has addressed vulnerabilities that could lead to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)(CVE-2024-28776), XML External Entity Injection (XXE)(CVE-2023-47160), Unauthorized access (CVE-2024-52902), Incorrect Authorization (CVE-2024-45081), Unrestricted Deserialization (CVE-2024-28777), Decrypt Highly Sensitive Information (CVE-2024-28780) and Formula Injection (CVE-2024-45084). Please refer to the table in the Related Information section for vulnerability impact. This Security Bulletin relates only to the direct usage of third-party components by IBM Cognos Controller and not any nested dependencies within the product.

ð CVE-2025-1132, CVE-2025-1133, CVE-2025-1134, CVE-2025-1135

https://github.com/pbatard/rufus/security/advisories/GHSA-p8p5-r296-g2jv

A DLL hijacking vulnerability in Rufus 4.6.2208 and earlier versions allows an attacker loading and executing a malicious DLL with escalated privileges (since the executable has been granted higher privileges during the time of launch) due to the ability to inject a malicious cfgmgr32.dll in the same directory as the executable and have it side load automatically.

##

CVE-2025-1414
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-18T21:15:25.440000

5 posts

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 135. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 135.0.1.

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2025-02-19T20:43:54.000Z ##

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T14:35:23.000Z ##

Mozilla advisory for a couple sev:HIGH memory safety bugs in Firefox below v135.0.1:

https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/advisories/mfsa2025-12/

CVE-2025-1414: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 135.0.1

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 135. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code.

CVE-2025-24118

updated 2025-02-18T20:15:29.843000

1 posts

The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iPadOS 17.7.4, macOS Sequoia 15.3, macOS Sonoma 14.7.3. An app may be able to cause unexpected system termination or write kernel memory.

A flaw was found in command/gpg. In some scenarios, hooks created by loaded modules are not removed when the related module is unloaded. This flaw allows an attacker to force grub2 to call the hooks once the module that registered it was unloaded, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. If correctly exploited, this vulnerability may result in arbitrary code execution, eventually allowing the at

##

CVE-2025-26603
(4.2 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-18T19:15:29.387000

1 posts

Vim is a greatly improved version of the good old UNIX editor Vi. Vim allows to redirect screen messages using the `:redir` ex command to register, variables and files. It also allows to show the contents of registers using the `:registers` or `:display` ex command. When redirecting the output of `:display` to a register, Vim will free the register content before storing the new content in the reg

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T19:14:40.000Z ##

@reverseics @neurovagrant Another one in vim:

https://github.com/vim/vim/security/advisories/GHSA-63p5-mwg2-787v

Vim allows to redirect screen messages using the :redir ex command to
register, variables and files. It also allows to show the contents of
registers using the :registers or :display ex command.

When redirecting the output of :display to a register, Vim will
free the register content before storing the new content in the
register. Now when redirecting the :display command to a register that
is being displayed, Vim will free the content while shortly afterwards
trying to access it, which leads to a use-after-free.

Vim pre 9.1.1115 checks in the ex_display() function, that it does not
try to redirect to a register while displaying this register at the same
time. However this check is not complete, and so Vim does not check the

  • and * registers (which typically donate the X11/clipboardregisters, and when a clipboard connection is not possible will fallback to use register 0 instead.

In Patch 9.1.1115 Vim will therefore skip outputting to register zero
when trying to redirect to the clipboard registers * or +.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-26603

CVE-2024-57963
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-18T09:32:49

1 posts

Insecure Loading of Dynamic Link Libraries have been discovered in USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER, which could allow local attackers to potentially disclose information or execute arbitray code on affected systems. This issue affects USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER:.

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T14:45:52.000Z ##

This specific vuln is unlikely to impact many, if any, people here, and search path vulns aren't always exciting, but it's not often you see them published in device drivers. That said, it is common in industrial systems like this one to see forever-days.

https://www.hitachi.com/hirt/hitachi-sec/2025/001.html

CVE-2024-57963: Insecure Loading of DLLs
The flaw in USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER exists.

Insecure Loading of Dynamic Link Libraries have been discovered in USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER and HVAC Energy Savings Program, which could allow local attackers to potentially disclose information or execute arbitrary code on affected systems. Exploitation of these vulnerabilities requires user interaction, such as opening a malicious file.

These vulnerabilities allow users to potentially disclose information or to execute arbitrary code on a vulnerable system.

And the kicker:

The USB-CONVERTERCABLE DRIVER and HVAC Energy Savings Program has already reached End of Life (EOL) and is not supported anymore. Hitachi recommends that this product be retired.

ð£ CVSS Score: 8.7
ð Published Date: 25/02/16
â ï¸ Details: A vulnerability classified as critical has been found in TOTOLINK X18 9.1.0cu.2024_B20220329.

Affected is the function setPasswordCfg of the file /cgi-bin/cstecgi.cgi. The manipulation as part of String leads to stack-based buffer overflow.

It is possible to launch the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.

CVE-2024-1086
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.28%

updated 2025-02-13T18:16:21.507000

1 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tables component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. The nft_verdict_init() function allows positive values as drop error within the hook verdict, and hence the nf_hook_slow() function can cause a double free vulnerability when NF_DROP is issued with a drop error which resembles NF_ACCEPT. We recommend upgradi

CVE-2022-35202
(5.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-13T18:15:27.630000

3 posts

A security issue in Sitevision version 10.3.1 and older allows a remote attacker, in certain (non-default) scenarios, to gain access to the private keys used for signing SAML Authn requests. The underlying issue is a Java keystore that may become accessible and downloadable via WebDAV. This keystore is protected with a low-complexity, auto-generated password.

_r_netsec@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-24T09:13:06.000Z ##

How auto-generated passwords in Sitevision leads to signing key leakage - CVE-2022-35202 https://www.shelltrail.com/research/how-auto-generated-passwords-in-sitevision-leads-to-signing-key-leakage-cve-2022-35202/

##
_r_netsec@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-21T09:58:06.000Z ##

CVE-2010-2861
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.39%

updated 2025-02-13T17:48:07.167000

1 posts

Multiple directory traversal vulnerabilities in the administrator console in Adobe ColdFusion 9.0.1 and earlier allow remote attackers to read arbitrary files via the locale parameter to (1) CFIDE/administrator/settings/mappings.cfm, (2) logging/settings.cfm, (3) datasources/index.cfm, (4) j2eepackaging/editarchive.cfm, and (5) enter.cfm in CFIDE/administrator/.

Nuclei template

AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T19:14:22.000Z ##

CISA and Partners Release Advisory on Ghost (Cring) Ransomware https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/02/19/cisa-and-partners-release-advisory-ghost-cring-ransomware

This relates to CVE-2018-13379, CVE-2010-2861, CVE-2009-3960, CVE-2021-34473, CVE-2021-34523, and CVE-2021-31207.

CVE-2023-36845
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 85.46%

updated 2025-02-13T17:16:43.583000

1 posts

A PHP External Variable Modification vulnerability in J-Web of Juniper Networks Junos OS on EX Series and SRX Series allows an unauthenticated, network-based attacker to remotely execute code. Using a crafted request which sets the variable PHPRC an attacker is able to modify the PHP execution environment allowing the injection und execution of code. This issue affects Juniper Networks Juno

CVE-2022-31631
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2025-02-13T00:33:04

2 posts

In PHP versions 8.0.* before 8.0.27, 8.1.* before 8.1.15, 8.2.* before 8.2.2 when using PDO::quote() function to quote user-supplied data for SQLite, supplying an overly long string may cause the driver to incorrectly quote the data, which may further lead to SQL injection vulnerabilities.

- CVE-2024-49035: Microsoft Partner Center Improper Access Control Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-49035

- CVE-2023-34192: Synacor Zimbra Collaboration Suite (ZCS) Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2023-34192

- Two Industrial Control Systems Advisories https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2025/02/25/cisa-releases-two-industrial-control-systems-advisories #CISA #cybersecurity #infosec #Microsoft

An issue has been discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions from 16.1 prior to 16.1.6, 16.2 prior to 16.2.9, 16.3 prior to 16.3.7, 16.4 prior to 16.4.5, 16.5 prior to 16.5.6, 16.6 prior to 16.6.4, and 16.7 prior to 16.7.2 in which user account password reset emails could be delivered to an unverified email address.

CVE-2024-23897
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.36%

updated 2024-12-20T17:30:33.613000

1 posts

Jenkins 2.441 and earlier, LTS 2.426.2 and earlier does not disable a feature of its CLI command parser that replaces an '@' character followed by a file path in an argument with the file's contents, allowing unauthenticated attackers to read arbitrary files on the Jenkins controller file system.

CVE-2024-9474
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.47%

updated 2024-12-20T16:49:55.993000

3 posts

A privilege escalation vulnerability in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software allows a PAN-OS administrator with access to the management web interface to perform actions on the firewall with root privileges. Cloud NGFW and Prisma Access are not impacted by this vulnerability.

jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T11:10:53.000Z ##

Palo Alto Networks warns that a file read vulnerability (CVE-2025-0111) is now being chained in attacks with two other flaws (CVE-2025-0108 with CVE-2024-9474) to breach PAN-OS firewalls in active attacks. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/palo-alto-networks-tags-new-firewall-bug-as-exploited-in-attacks/

0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T11:25:07.000Z ##

**Deutsche Version (Umschrieben):**

Moin Leute! CISA KEV meldet sich mal wieder zu Wort ð¨ Und diesmal geht's um Palo Alto (CVE-2025-0108) und SonicWall (CVE-2024-53704). Die haben's echt faustdick hinter den Ohren! Wir reden hier von Authentication Bypass und Improper Auth, und zwar direkt im VPN-Bereich. Das tut weh!

Als Pentester sehe ich sowas ja leider tÃ¤glich. ð© VPNs sind halt oft die Haupteinfallsrouten. Wenn da Unbefugte reinkommen, ist das natÃ¼rlich megaÃ¤tzend. Und hinterher heiÃt es dann immer: "HÃ¤tten wir doch bloÃ..."

Und das Schlimmste: Palo Alto kann man sogar noch chainen (CVE-2024-9474 & CVE-2025-0111) ð¤¯ GreyNoise hat bereits Exploits entdeckt! Also, Leute, was heiÃt das? Patchen, patchen, patchen! Security by Design muss einfach Standard sein!

Habt ihr eure Systeme schon geupdatet? Wie sind eure Erfahrungen mit Palo Alto/SonicWall? ErzÃ¤hlt mal, bin gespannt!

#infosec #pentest #cisa #vpn

**Englische Version (Umschrieben und Ãbersetzt):**

Hey everyone! CISA KEV is back with an update ð¨ This time it's about Palo Alto (CVE-2025-0108) and SonicWall (CVE-2024-53704), and let me tell you, these are nasty! We're talking about Authentication Bypass and Improper Auth, right in the VPN space. Ouch!

As a pentester, I see this stuff all the time, unfortunately. ð© VPNs are often the number one entry point. Unauthorized access? That's a big no-no. And then everyone says, "If only we had..."

But here's the kicker: you can even chain Palo Alto (CVE-2024-9474 & CVE-2025-0111) ð¤¯ GreyNoise has already spotted exploits in the wild! So what does that mean? Patch, patch, patch! Security by Design simply has to be the standard!

Have you updated your systems yet? What are your experiences with Palo Alto/SonicWall? Let me know in the comments!

#infosec #pentest #cisa #vpn

1 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media: uvcvideo: Skip parsing frames of type UVC_VS_UNDEFINED in uvc_parse_format This can lead to out of bounds writes since frames of this type were not taken into account when calculating the size of the frames buffer in uvc_parse_streaming.

CVE-2024-3400
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.26%

updated 2024-11-29T16:47:54.893000

1 posts

A command injection as a result of arbitrary file creation vulnerability in the GlobalProtect feature of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software for specific PAN-OS versions and distinct feature configurations may enable an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the firewall. CVE-2024-9632
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-21T19:15:14.210000

2 posts

A flaw was found in the X.org server. Due to improperly tracked allocation size in _XkbSetCompatMap, a local attacker may be able to trigger a buffer overflow condition via a specially crafted payload, leading to denial of service or local privilege escalation in distributions where the X.org server is run with root privileges.

evangelos@libretooth.gr at 2025-02-19T12:08:50.000Z ##

no way to prevent this #c #clang
https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2024-9632/

##
Edent@mastodon.social at 2025-02-18T14:36:05.000Z ##

@binder
I've literally just had to set up an app specific password and futz about on the command-line to generate an email for a one-line Linux patch. That's hardly better.

As for C - https://xeiaso.net/shitposts/no-way-to-prevent-this/CVE-2024-9632/

Lots of projects manage their communities well. Doing the hard work *is* the work.

Your last paragraph proves my point. People want to contribute, but the system makes it hard. So they go off to places which have an easier on-ramp for new contributors.

##

CVE-2023-38408
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 4.40%

updated 2024-11-21T08:13:30.520000

1 posts

The PKCS#11 feature in ssh-agent in OpenSSH before 9.3p2 has an insufficiently trustworthy search path, leading to remote code execution if an agent is forwarded to an attacker-controlled system. (Code in /usr/lib is not necessarily safe for loading into ssh-agent.) NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2016-10009.

7 repos

https://github.com/kali-mx/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/Nick-Morbid/cve-2023-38408

https://github.com/wxrdnx/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/fazilbaig1/cve_2023_38408_scanner

https://github.com/LucasPDiniz/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/mrtacojr/CVE-2023-38408

https://github.com/classic130/CVE-2023-38408

_r_netsec@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-22T01:43:06.000Z ##

lukasberancz@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-17T10:55:40.000Z ##

ððð ðð ððððððð ððððð ððððððð ðð ðððððð ððððððððððð

Print Spooler is a service that takes care of print management. This includes, but is not limited to, managing printer drivers, scheduling print jobs, etc.

Print Spooler had a critical vulnerability in the past referred to as PrintNightmare (CVE-2021-34527). This vulnerability allowed attackers to execute code with administrator privileges.

The Print Spooler vulnerability was patched promptly, so if you have updated systems, the immediate risk associated with PrintNightmare is no longer present. And for normal systems, it is usually not feasible to disable Print Spooler. It would make printing impossible, which is usually not desirable.

But domain controllers are a critical part of Active Directory and need to be as secure as possible, which means blocking everything that is not needed. And you certainly should not need to print on domain controllers, so itâs a good idea to disable Print Spooler on domain controllers.

ðº Watch my YouTube video bellow on how to disable Print Spooler on Domain Controllers ð ð
https://youtu.be/O80HHKdnbcQ

#cswlrd #printspooler #domaincontrollers #printnightmare #videotutorial

CVE-2025-27091

DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T19:30:35.000Z ##

ð¨CVE-2025-27091: OpenH264 Decoding Functions Heap Overflow Vulnerability

https://darkwebinformer.com/cve-2025-27091-openh264-decoding-functions-heap-overflow-vulnerability/

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-20T19:20:29.000Z ##

sev:HIGH heap overflow via race in OpenH264 decoding.

https://github.com/cisco/openh264/security/advisories/GHSA-m99q-5j7x-7m9x

A vulnerability in the decoding functions of OpenH264 codec library could allow a remote, unauthenticated attacker to trigger a heap overflow.

This vulnerability is due to a race condition between a Sequence Parameter Set (SPS) memory allocation and a subsequent non Instantaneous Decoder Refresh (non-IDR) Network Abstraction Layer (NAL) unit memory usage. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by crafting a malicious bitstream and tricking a victim user into processing an arbitrary video containing the malicious bistream. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause an unexpected crash in the victim's user decoding client and, possibly, perform arbitrary commands on the victim's host by abusing the heap overflow.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2025-27091

CVE-2025-26466

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2025-02-19T16:50:01.000Z ##

CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466 Vulnerabilities Expose Systems to Man-in-the-Middle and DoS Attacks â Source: socprime.com https://ciso2ciso.com/cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466-vulnerabilities-expose-systems-to-man-in-the-middle-and-dos-attacks-source-socprime-com/ #rssfeedpostgeneratorecho #CyberSecurityNews #cve-2025-26465 #cve-2025-26466 #Latestthreats #Vulnerability #socprimecom #socprime #Blog #CVE

##
BenjaminHCCarr@hachyderm.io at 2025-02-19T15:26:00.000Z ##

New #OpenSSH flaws expose #SSH servers to #MiTM and #DoS attacks
The MiTM vulnerability, tracked under CVE-2025-26465, was introduced in December 2014 with the release of OpenSSH 6.8p1, so the issue remained undetected for over a decade. The flaw affects OpenSSH clients when the '#VerifyHostKeyDNS' option is enabled.
The denial of service vulnerability is CVE-2025-26466, a pre-authentication denial of service flaw introduced in OpenSSH 9.5p1, released in August 2023.
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-openssh-flaws-expose-ssh-servers-to-mitm-and-dos-attacks/

##
GossiTheDog@cyberplace.social at 2025-02-19T09:06:55.000Z ##

Qualys dropped another two OpenSSH vulns this week - CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466

I donât think either are bad, you should keep calm and patch as per usual.

The first one needs a non-default config, and PoC for the second also uses a non-default config. Neither are RCE and I doubt will ever see in the wild exploitation.

Blog: https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2025/02/18/qualys-tru-discovers-two-vulnerabilities-in-openssh-cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466

Proof of concept: https://www.qualys.com/2025/02/18/openssh-mitm-dos.txt

ryanc@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-19T07:15:11.000Z ##

New SSH CVEs just dropped:

https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2025/02/18/qualys-tru-discovers-two-vulnerabilities-in-openssh-cve-2025-26465-cve-2025-26466

##
0x40k@infosec.exchange at 2025-02-18T19:30:33.000Z ##

Ugh, OpenSSH *again*... Seriously? We've got two fresh vulnerabilities hitting us, CVE-2025-26465 & CVE-2025-26466. Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) and Denial of Service (DoS). On the surface, it might not seem like a huge deal, but let's be real â SSH is *everywhere*, isn't it? ð

Turns out, `VerifyHostKeyDNS` is the culprit behind the MitM vulnerability. So, folks, time to double-check your configs! Otherwise, someone could sneak in and snatch your SSH sessions right out from under you. ð¬ And the DoS? That impacts both the client and the server, gobbling up resources left and right. Server goes down, admins get furious, and users get locked out. Not a good look.

Good news, though! OpenSSH 9.9p2 is officially out! So, you know what that means â get patching ASAP! ð

As a pentester, I constantly see how underestimated SSH is. People are all like, "Oh, it's *just* SSH..." Nope! Security in Depth is absolutely crucial. Customers always want to quickly buy a product instead of getting proper consulting.

So, have you already applied the patch? What SSH hardening tips do you swear by? ð¤

#infosec #openssh #pentest

ð¨ Critical Security Vulnerability
ð CVE-2025-26605, CVE-2025-26606, CVE-2025-26607, CVE-2025-26608, CVE-2025-26609, CVE-2025-26610, CVE-2025-26611, CVE-2025-26612, CVE-2025-26613, CVE-2025-26614, CVE-2025-26615, CVE-2025-26616, CVE-2025-26617
ð£ CVSS Score: 9.4, 10, 10, 10, 10, 9.4, 10, 10, 10, 9.4, 10, 10, 10
ð Published Date: 25/02/18
â ï¸ Details: WeGIA is an open source Web Manager for Institutions with a focus on Portuguese language users. A SQL Injection vulnerability was discovered in the WeGIA application, `deletar_cargo.php` endpoint. This vulnerability could allow an authorized attacker to execute arbitrary SQL queries, allowing access to sensitive information. This issue has been addressed in version 3.2.13 and all users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

komelt@toot.tux.si at 2025-02-16T12:41:49.000Z ##

It isn't much but it is honest work ð.

Yesterday, my first CVE (CVE-2025-21608) was published by @meshtastic. While doing security research for the class Security of Systems on UNI LJ FRI. I discovered a critical vulnerability in its firmware that allowed an attacker to bypass PKI and impersonate any user.

The vulnerability was tested only for text messages, but it could also probably affect remote admin control.

I hope this isn't my last CVE. ð

https://github.com/meshtastic/firmware/security/advisories/GHSA-c967-qc39-3hf5
